1.author: Adams, George Matthew
1.quote: There is no such thing as a self-made man. We are made up of thousands of others. Everyone who has ever done a kind deed for us, or spoken one word of encouragement to us, has entered into the makeup of our character and our thoughts, as well as our success.

2.author: Young, Edward
2.quote: Too low they build who build below the skies.

3.author: Zimmerman
3.quote: In Fame's temple there is always a niche to be found for rich dunces, importunate scoundrels or successful butchers of the human race.

4.author: Boyle, Charles P.
4.quote: The success of any venture will be helped by prayer, even in the wrong denomination.

5.author: Boyle, Charles P.
5.quote: Success can be insured only by devising a defense against the contingency plan.

6.author: Brecht, Bertold
6.quote: Why be a man when you can be a success?

7.author: Brien, Richard H.
7.quote: At some time in the life cycle of virtually every organization, its ability to succeed in spite of itself runs out.

8.author: Alderson, M.H.
8.quote: If at first you don't succeed you're running about average.

9.author: Bunyan
9.quote: First must give place to last, because last must have his time to come; but last gives place to nothing, for there is not another to succeed.

10.author: Byron, Lord
10.quote: He who surpasses or subdues mankind, must look down on the hate of those below.

11.author: Casson, Herbert N.
11.quote: The men who succeed are the efficient few. They are the few who have the ambition and will power to develop themselves.

12.author: Cicero
12.quote: When you are aspiring to the highest place, it is honorable to reach the second or even the third rank.

13.author: Cicero
13.quote: The noblest spirit is most strongly attracted by thelove of glory.

14.author: Cocteau, Jean
14.quote: We must believe in luck for how else can we explain the success of those we don't like?

15.author: Cohen, Jerome
15.quote: What really matters is the name you succeed in imposing on the facts not the facts themselves.

16.author: Colton, Charles Caleb
16.quote: Constant success shows us but one side of the world; adversity brings out the reverse of the picture.

17.author: Conrad, Joseph
17.quote: All ambitions are lawful except those which climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.

18.author: Cossman
18.quote: Obstacles are things a person sees when he takes his eyes off his goal.

19.author: de Montaigne, Michel
19.quote: Even on the most exalted throne in the world we areonly sitting on our own bottom.

20.author: de Montainge, Michel
20.quote: Ambition is not a vice of little people.

21.author: de Tocqueville, Alexis
21.quote: Men will never establish any equality with which they can be contented. Whatever efforts a people may make, they will never succeed in reducing all the conditions of society to a perfect level.

22.author: Dewar, Thomas R.
22.quote: The road to success is filled with women pushing their husbands along.

23.author: Disraeli, Benjamin
23.quote: As a general rule, the most successful man in life is the man who has the best information.

24.author: Disraeli, Benjamin
24.quote: Success is the child of audacity.

25.author: Anon.
25.quote: Behind every successful man stands an amazed woman.

26.author: Douglas, Kirk
26.quote: If you become a success, you don't change everyone else does.

28.author: Einstein, Albert
28.quote: Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value

29.author: Einstein, Albert
29.quote: If A equals success, then the formula is A equals X plus Y and Z, with X being work, Y play, and Z keeping your mouth shut.

30.author: Eliot, George
30.quote: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are thoroughly alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good, and we must hunger after them.

31.author: Elliott, L.G.
31.quote: Vacillating people seldom succeed. They seldom win the solid respect of their fellow men. Successful men and women are very careful in reaching decisions and very persistent and determined in action thereafter.

32.author: Ellis, David
32.quote: If the probability of success is not almost one, then it is damn near zero.

33.author: Emerson, Ralph Waldo
33.quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.

34.author: Emerson, Ralph Waldo
34.quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.

35.author: Emerson, Ralph Waldo
35.quote: Build a better mousetrap and the world will beat a path to your door.

36.author: English, Thomas Dunn
36.quote: Ambition is the germ from which all growth of nobleness proceeds.

37.author: Evelyn, Douglas
37.quote: Support organizations can always prove success by showing service to someone ... not necessarily you.

38.author: Ezra, Moses Ibn
38.quote: Success - keeping your mind awake and your desire asleep.

39.author: Farmer, Richard N.
39.quote: Seers and soothsayers read crystal balls to find the future. Less lucky men read junk with more success.

40.author: Feather, William
40.quote: Success makes us intolerant of failure, and failure makes us intolerant of success.

41.author: Fields, W.C.
41.quote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try, again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about things.

42.author: Flaubert, George
42.quote: Success, as I see it, is a result, not a goal.

43.author: Ford, Henry
43.quote: Before everything else, getting ready is the secret of success.

44.author: Archimedes
44.quote: Give me a firm place to stand, and I will move the earth.

45.author: German Proverb
45.quote: Who begins too much accomplishes little.

46.author: Getty, J. Paul
46.quote: The meek shall inherit the earth, but not its mineral rights.

47.author: Giraudoux, Jean
47.quote: The secret of success is sincerity. Once you can fake that you've got it made.

48.author: Giraudoux, Jean
48.quote: Only the mediocre are always at their best.

49.author: Goethe
49.quote: Men are so constituted that everybody undertakes what he sees another successful in, whether he has aptitude for it or not.

50.author: Goethe
50.quote: Man errs as long as he strives.

51.author: Hemingway, Ernest
51.quote: To be a successful father there's one absolute rule: when you have a kid, don't look at it for the first two years.

52.author: Hitler, Adolf
52.quote: Success is the sole earthly judge of right and wrong.

53.author: Bach, Richard
53.quote: That's what learning is, after all; not whether we lose the game, but how we lose and how we've changed because of it and what we take away from it that we never had before, to apply to other games. Losing, in a curious way, is winning.

54.author: Homer
54.quote: A man dies still if he has done nothing, as one who has done much.

55.author: Backus, Jim
55.quote: Many a man owes his success to his first wife and his second wife to his success.

56.author: Horace
56.quote: Nothing is too high for the daring of mortals: we storm heaven itself in our folly.

57.author: Hubbard, Kin
57.quote: Some folks can look so busy doing nothin' that they seem indispensable.

58.author: Hume, David
58.quote: Where ambition can cover its enterprises, even to the person himself, under the appearance of principle, it is the most incurable and inflexible of passions.

59.author: Hume, David
59.quote: There ambition can cover its enterprises, even to the person himself, under the appearance of principle, it is the most incurable and inflexibl eof passions.

60.author: Italian Proverb
60.quote: It is not enough to aim, you must hit.

61.author: James, William
61.quote: The moral flabbiness born of the exclusive worship of the Bitch-Goddess success. That - with the squalid cash interpretation put on the word success - is our national disease.

62.author: Johnson, Lyndon B.
62.quote: We have seen too much success to have become obsessed with failure.

63.author: Johnson, Samuel
63.quote: Life affords no higher pleasure than that of surmounting difficulties, passing from one step of success to another, forming new wishes and seeing them gratified.

64.author: Jones, E. Stanley
64.quote: We grow small trying to be great.

65.author: Jones, Richard Lloyd
65.quote: Stability is more essential to success than brilliance.

66.author: Kaat, Jim
66.quote: I'll never be considered one of the all-time greats; maybe not even one of the all-time goods. But I'm one of the all-time survivors.

67.author: Kirkpatrick, George R.
67.quote: Nature gave man two ends one to sit on and one to think with. Ever since then man's success or failure has been dependent on the one he used most.

68.author: la Rochefoucauld, Francois
68.quote: To establish ourselves in the world, we have to do all we can to appear established. To succeed in the world, we do everything we can to appear successful.

69.author: Banks, Harry F.
69.quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.

70.author: Lawson, T.K.
70.quote: There is a time in the tides of men, Which, taken at its flood, leads on to success. On the other hand, don't count on it.

71.author: Lilly, William
71.quote: Ambition has one heel nailed in well, though she stretch her fingers to touch the heavens.

72.author: Little, M.W.
72.quote: The penalty of success is to be bored by the attentions of people who formerly snubbed you.

73.author: Lombardi, Vince
73.quote: The greatest accomplishment is not in never falling, but in rising again after you fall.

74.author: Longfellow, Henry Wadsworth
74.quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.

75.author: Lucas, George
75.quote: Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try. (Yoda, Star Wars)

77.author: Machiavelli, Niccol?
77.quote: Ambition is so powerful a passion in the human breast, that however high we reach we are never satisfied.

78.author: MacInnes, Colin
78.quote: Pubs make you as drunk as they can as soon as they can, and turn nasty when they succeed.

79.author: Marquis, Don
79.quote: The successful people are the ones who can think up things for the rest of the world to keep busy at.

80.author: Marshall, Peter
80.quote: It is better to fail in a cause that will ultimately succeed than to succeed in a cause that will ultimately fail.

81.author: Marx, Groucho
81.quote: We in the industry know that behind every successful screenwriter stands a woman. And behind her stands his wife.

82.author: Bass, Stacey
82.quote: If at first you don't succeed, blame it on the teach

83.author: Mencken, H.L.
83.quote: All successful newspapers are ceaselessly querulous and bellicose. They never defend anyone or anything if they can help it; if the job is forced upon them, they tackle it by denouncing someone or something else.

84.author: Midler, Bette
84.quote: The worst part of having success is to try finding someone who is happy for you.

85.author: Mizner, William
85.quote: The gent who wakes up and finds himself a success hasn't been asleep.

86.author: Moore, Richard F.
86.quote: ... high salaries equals happiness equals project success.

87.author: Morley, Christopher
87.quote: There is only one success ... to be able to spend your life in your own way, and not to give others absurd maddening claims upon it.

88.author: Morris, Lewis
88.quote: How far high failure overleaps the bounds of low success.

89.author: Morrow, Dwight
89.quote: The world is divided into people who do things and people who get the credit.

90.author: Napolean
90.quote: If you wish to be a success in the world, promise everything, deliver nothing.

91.author: Nathan, George Jean
91.quote: A life spent in constant labor is a life wasted, save a man be such a fool as to regard a fulsome obituary notice as ample reward.

92.author: Newton, Howard W.
92.quote: When a man blames others for his failures, it's a good idea to credit others with his successes.

93.author: Nietzsche, Friedrich
93.quote: Success has always been a great liar.

94.author: Nixon, Richard
94.quote: The successful leader does not talk down to people. He lifts them up.

95.author: Nixon, Richard
95.quote: Success is not a harbor but a voyage with its own perils to the spirit. The game of life is to come up a winner, to be a success, or to achieve what we set out to do. Yet there is always the danger of failing as a human being. The lesson that most of us o

96.author: Novaes,Carlos Eduardo
96.quote: Each person has the right to take part in the management of public affairs in his country, provided he has prior experience, a will to succeed, a college degree, influential parents, good looks, a resume, two 3X4 snapshots, and a good tax record.

97.author: Beecher, Henry Ward
97.quote: It is not the going out of port, but the coming in, that determines the success of a voyage.

98.author: Beecher, Henry Ward
98.quote: A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires.

99.author: Otway, Thomas
99.quote: Ambition is a lust that is never quenched, but grows more inflamed and madder by enjoyment.

100.author: Beerbohm, Max
100.quote: There is much to be said for failure. It is more interesting than success.

101.author: Partridge, Andy
101.quote: Success is being nothing but a quote.

102.author: Paterno, Joe
102.quote: Success without honor is an unseasoned dish; it will satisfy your hunger, but it won't taste good.

103.author: Paturi, Felix R.
103.quote: The amount of success is in inverse proportion to the effort in attaining success.

104.author: Paturi, Felix R.
104.quote: Success is the result of behavior that completely contradicts the usual expectations about the behavior of a successful person.

105.author: Penn, William
105.quote: The tallest trees are most in the power of the winds, and ambitious men of the blasts of fortune.

106.author: Pike, Douglas
106.quote: Success provides more opportunities to say things than the number of things a pundit has worth saying.

107.author: Pile, Stephen
107.quote: Success is overrated. Incompetence is what we should revere it marks us off from animals.

108.author: Pope John XXIII
108.quote: There are three ways a man can be ruined: women,gambling, and farming. My father chose the most boring.

109.author: Porsche
109.quote: If we learn for each success, and each failure, and improve ourselves through this process, then, at the end, we will havefulfilled our potential and performed well.

110.author: Quayle, J. Danforth
110.quote: If we don't succeed, we run the risk of failure.

111.author: Rickenbacker, Edward
111.quote: I can give you a six-word formula for success: "Think things through - then follow through."

112.author: Riggs, Donald
112.quote: The successful person is the individual who forms the habit of doing what the failing person doesn't like to do.

113.author: Berle, Milton
113.quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.

114.author: Romain, William
114.quote: If a man is happy in his work exerting himself to the full extent of his capabilities, and enjoying it I'd say he's a success.

115.author: Roosevelt, Theodore
115.quote: I'm not a good shot, but I shoot often.

116.author: Berlin, Irving
116.quote: Success is one unpardonable sin against one's fellows.

117.author: Ruskin
117.quote: The highest reward for a person's toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.

118.author: Russel, Rosalind
118.quote: Success is a public affair. Failure is a private funeral.

119.author: Schweitzer, Albert
119.quote: A man can do only what he can do. But if he does that each day he can sleep at night and do it again the next day.

120.author: Scott, Sir Walter
120.quote: He that climbs the tall tree has won right to the fruit, He that leaps the wide gulf should prevail in his suit.

121.author: Seneca
121.quote: It is the constant fault and inseparable evil quality of ambition, that it never looks behind it.

122.author: Shakespeare, William
122.quote: The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.

123.author: Shakespeare, William
123.quote: Ambition should be made of sterner stuff.

124.author: Shakespeare, William
124.quote: To climb steep hills requires slow pace at first.

125.author: Shaw, George Bernard
125.quote: I dread success. To have succeeded is to have finished one's business on earth, like the male spider who is killed by the female the moment he has succeeded in courtship. I like a state of continual becoming, with a goal in front and not behind.

126.author: Shula, Don
126.quote: Success is not forever, and failure is not fatal.

127.author: Simmons, Edward R.
127.quote: The difference between failure and success is doing a thing nearly right and doing a thing exactly right.

128.author: Smith, Charles Merrill
128.quote: If at first you don't succeed, you must be doing something wrong.

129.author: Spengler, Oswald
129.quote: The secret of all victory lies in the organization of the non-obvious.

130.author: Stanley, Arthur P.
130.quote: There are glimpses of heaven to us in every act, or thought, or word, that raises us above ourselves.

131.author: Stevenson, John
131.quote: Many people have the ambition to succeed in their work; they may even have special aptitude for their job. And yet they do not move ahead. Why? Perhaps they think that since they can master the job, there is no need to master themselves.

132.author: Sting
132.quote: Given the choice of friendship or success, I'd probably choose success.

133.author: Blake, William
133.quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.

134.author: Streisand, Barbra
134.quote: Success to me is having ten honeydew melons and only eating the top half of each one.

135.author: Swetchine, Anne Sophie
135.quote: How easy to be amiable in the midst of happiness and success.

136.author: Swift, Jonathan
136.quote: Ambition often puts men upon doing the meanest offices: so climbing is performed in the same posture with creeping.

137.author: Swope, Herbert Bayard
137.quote: I cannot give you the formula for success, but I can give you the formula for failure which is: Try to please everybody.

138.author: Syrus, Publilius
138.quote: Mighty rivers can easily be leaped at their source.

139.author: Syrus, Publius
139.quote: If you wish to reach the highest, begin at the lowest.

140.author: Thoreau, Henry David
140.quote: We must walk consciously only part way toward our goal, and then leap in the dark to our success.

141.author: Thoreau, Henry David
141.quote: I have learned this at least by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.

142.author: Thoreau, Henry David
142.quote: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.

143.author: Tomlin, Lily
143.quote: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.

144.author: Bombolini, Italo
144.quote: There is nothing more difficult to carry out and more doubtful of success than to initiate a new order of things. For the reformer has enemies in all who prosper by the old order.

145.author: Twain, Mark
145.quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then Success is sure.

146.author: Twain, Mark
146.quote: There is no use in your walking five miles to fish when you can depend on being just as unsuccessful near home.

147.author: Unknown
147.quote: He who never fell never climbed.

148.author: Unknown
148.quote: Success is more attitude then aptitude.

149.author: Vidal, Gore
149.quote: It is not enough to succeed. Others must fail.

150.author: von Sternberg
150.quote: The only way to succeed is to make people hate you. That way, they remember you.

151.author: Waggoner, Fred
151.quote: Success is relevant to coping with obstacles... But no problem is ever solved by those, who, when they fail, look for someone to blame instead of something to do.

152.author: Washington, Booker T.
152.quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.

153.author: Washington, Booker T.
153.quote: You can't hold a man down without staying down with him.

154.author: Webster
154.quote: There's always room at the top.

155.author: Wilde, Oscar
155.quote: Moderation is a fatal thing nothing succeeds like excess.

156.author: Wilde, Oscar
156.quote: Ambition is the last refuge of failure.

157.author: Wilde, Oscar
157.quote: Experience is the name that everyone gives to his mistakes.
